alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pondera and east central Teton Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dutton, or 18 miles southeast of Conrad, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady and Collins. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 315 and 335. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding, especially in low- lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
